alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 10:47PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong line of thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Randolph and Pocahontas Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1045 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong line of thunderstorms from near Snowshoe, or 7 miles northeast of Marlinton, to Hillsboro moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marlinton, Cass Scenic Railroad, Greenbank, Snowshoe, Mingo, Hillsboro, Dunmore, Arbovale, Cranberry Mountain Nature Center, Slaty Fork, Minnehaha Springs, Frost, Edray, Buckeye, and Valley Head. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph
